sub_title: Senior Software Designer at Philips Medical Systems

treasury_media.title: SMDS_HSMStateEngine
treasury_media.description: Design of a state engine DSL

authors.headline: Senior Software Designer at Philips Medical Systems

profile_positions.description:
(Current)(Software designer) at Displays group. Het I work at 
video distribution and 1th/3th workstations integration. Our 
system can process up to 16 FHD signals and display them in any 
configuration on large screen and on multiple work-spot 
configurations

(Software designer) Again I was assigned back to geometry due to 
the great project related difficulties there (Aditi). I helped 
increasing the software quality and implemented features in 
different areas like field service procedures, FDPA (scanning 
diagnostic procedure), motor drive software and solved 
numerous problem reports. I used IBM Rhapsody code generation 
for implementing the features. 

(Software designer) When the study of the acquisition 
architecture was completed, the architecture was to be 
productized and I made an analysis of the control architecture 
using different UML tools. The architecture was modeled and 
simulated and after approval the architecture was deployed to 
reverse the event driven architecture into a control driven 
architecture. Even today I am working on completing the 
architecture/design, the size of the sub-system is ~4000Kloc 
C++/C# deployed in 29 Clear Case projects.

(Software designer) I was assigned back to geometry to design 
and realize a prototype for an adapter that enabled interfacing 
with third party surgery tables. Again I used my DSL state 
machine pattern.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Designer

profile_positions.description:
(Software designer) I transferred to the acquisition software 
group where I performed a study for the introduction of the new 
acquisition related subsystem architecture. The ‘old’ architecture 
was event driven and the assignment stated that the architecture 
was to be a controlled architecture. The sub-system boundaries 
are specified in ASD, I used my previous created state machine 
DSL to implement the state behaviors.

(Software designer) The last feature I implemented for the 
Patient & Beam was the restriction interface, which is intended to 
handle advanced interactive error handling towards the user. The 
restriction interface controls 12 movements and 24 sensor 
inputs per movement to make sure the system can be moved 
safely, in case of errors or collisions the interface enables the user 
to override specific errors in order to complete the procedure on 
the patient safely in any circumstance. For this purpose I created 
a Domain Specific Language (DSL) to describe complex state 
behaviors. Because of the complexity of the software and the 
state driven behaviors the design is simulated by a student using 
ASD (Verum analytical software design).

(Software designer) Designed and implemented the 
Patient&Beam which function is to control multiple movements 
either manually or automatically. This software unit is also 
responsible for interactive error handling towards the end user. 
The unit is ~300Kloc C++ supported by a unit test of ~200Kloc 
executing ~6000 automatic test-cases. The unit services all the x-ray 
products and is still planned to be used in future 
architectures.
profile_positions.title: ing

profile_positions.description:
During my time at this company I was assigned to Philips Medical Systems 
where I worked on the Geometry software platform for interventional x-
ray systems. I made software for controlling complex motion patterns 
that aided 3D reconstruction. I created simulation environments and 
system testing frameworks still used today by the geometry department. 
I also implemented and maintained APC and DRA procedures for the 
integris platform. My tools were RMX/VxWorks operating systems and 
made the software using the C/C++ programming languages
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer
